newsitem.title: EGYPT: PRESS DIGEST - Egypt economic press - May 4.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Egypt economic press - May 4.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian economic press this week. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Six traders have been elected to the bourse administration to see to its development as the exchange enters a new stage.

- Egyptian Kuwaiti Holding Company, now under subscription, is expected to have its shares listed in Kuwait as part of the agreement between the two countries to link their bourses. National Bank of Kuwait will undertake on behalf of Commercial International Bank to list the company's shares. It is the largest investment firm to be set up in Egypt so far.
- Total applications for Egyptian Gulf Bank investment fund were worth 260 million pounds. The bank had raised the value of its mutual fund from 50 million pounds to 100 million.

- Door is open through May 8 for subscription to Egyptian Industrial Bank's 350,000 shares or 8.33 percent of Misr Gulf Oil Processing. Of the shares 173,000 are in pounds and the rest in dollars. The subscription is open to main investors. The minimum application is for 10,000 shares.

- Holding Company for Housing, Tourism and Cinema has increased the amount of shares it had offered for sale in Development and Engineering Consultancy to 25.25 percent of the company's capital. Sale will be 36.5 pounds per share, which is the level where most of the offers have focused.
- Central and West Delta Flour Mills pre-tax profits in the first nine months of the year to end March reached 53.83 million pounds compared to 36 million pounds in the previous period.
- Cairo Pharmaceuticals and Chemical Industries profits were 22.7 million pounds in the first nine months of the year compared to 20.11 million pounds in the same period the previous year.
- Pfizer-Egypt had profits after taxes of 17.9 million pounds.

- Extracted Oils and Derivatives had pre-tax profits in the first nine months of the year ending in March of 19.148 million pounds compared to 15.181 million pounds in the same period the previous year.
- Kafr el-Zayat Pesticides and Chemicals pre-tax profits and reserves were 13.451 million pounds in the first nine months of the year, up more than 200 percent.
